basics.name: Inge Gatovsky©
basics.label: Cloud Engineer
basics.summary: is a dedicated student pursuing a degree in Systems Engineering from Mexico. Python is his favorite language and which he masters best, he performs optimally in the use of technologies such as Docker, Pulumi SDK, Bash and K8S integrated with AWS cloud services. He's passionate about Machine Learning and Linux systems, always eager to learn new skills and technologies.

about.title: Professional Background
about.content: He is a cloud engineer with experience in developing cloud infrastructure modules using the Pulumi SDK with Python. He has a solid foundation in Python and is proficient in Docker, Bash and Kubernetes. He's an expert in AWS cloud services including VPC, EC2, EKS, ALB, IAM, Lambda, API Gateway and S3.

about.title: Achievements
about.content: He has achieved several awards and recognitions, including 1st place in the Competitive Programming contest at ITCancun in 2023 and 3rd place in the Genius Arena - Jalisco Talent Land 2024. He has also taken several courses in Python, Docker and Data Science, obtaining certifications from IBM, Cisco and the University of Michigan.

about.title: Career Goals
about.content: he's seeking a challenging position as a Cloud Engineer where can leverage his skills and experience to develop innovative cloud solutions. An passionate about technology and committed to continuous learning and professional development.

experience.summary: As a Cloud Engineer I write modules for deploy resources to the AWS cloud. Some of the tasks I do are to test the code ones made by other teammates and integrate them into the repository.
highlights: Automated development environments using Docker and Bash, enhancing efficiency for developers.
Deployed APIs utilizing API Gateway and AWS Lambda to streamline application performance.
Refactored code and integrated updates into the project repository to improve codebase maintainability.
Resolved Git conflicts to facilitate smooth collaboration and version control.
Reviewed and approved pull requests, ensuring adherence to coding standards and project requirements.

experience.summary: As a Python Developer, I engineered cloud infrastructure modules using the Pulumi SDK with Python, I also identified and implemented process improvements to enhance system performance and efficiency.
highlights: Developed cloud infrastructure modules using the Pulumi SDK with Python, including VPC, EC2, EKS, ALB, IAM, and S3 services.
Identified and implemented process improvements to enhance system performance and efficiency.
Developed and maintained repository documentation to ensure clear communication and alignment within the team.
Competitive Programing - ITCancún 2023 – 1st place - Internal competitive programming contest at ITCancún, where exceptional team collaboration and problem solving were demonstrated.
Competitive Programing - ITCancún 2022 - 7th place - Participated in individual programming contest at ITCancún, where problem solving were demonstrated.

awards.title: Genius Arena – Jalisco Talent Land 2024 – 3rd place
awards.summary: As part of the SISA track: Anomaly detection by traffic analysis in navigation, I led the Redeemed Guys team in the SiSaGuard project.

awards.title: Speaker – Jalisco Talent Land 2024 – Developer Land
awards.summary: Talk “Simplify and regulate your development processes in the cloud” as part of the promotion of the Archie by cloudbuddies platform.

courses.title: Python for AI and Web Dev.
